description.narrative: The objective of the project is to protect human health and the environment locally through elimination of POPs and obsolete pesticide stockpiles, and addressing associated contaminated sites within a sound chemicals management framework.
capital of a political entity

description.narrative: Obsolete Pesticide stockpiles including POPs Pesticides and wastes are securely packaged contained and stored pending elimination

comment.narrative:
The major current obsolete pesticide stockpile site and major remaining location of POPs pesticides is at the Nubarashen burial site in a state that creates a risk to health and the environment And has expanded to create a significant contaminated site
Lesser stockpiles and associated site contamination exist unaddressed at 24 OP storehouses
Contaminated soils classified sufficiently to constitute a potent risk remain uncontained at some of these storehouse sites

Removal and export of Pure obsolete pesticides and highly contaminated POPs waste for environmentally sound destruction

description.narrative: 1. Availability of securely excavated, packaged and stored obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste for elimination. 2. Availability of destroyed obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste in an environmentally sound manner. 3. Availability of updated national legislation and regulatory framework for hazardous waste management and of core national technical capacity relative to hazardous waste management.

comment.narrative: 1. Obsolete pesticide stockpiles including persistent organic pollutant pesticides and wastes are buried or stored insecurely. (2014) 2. No elimination attempted. (2014) 3. Current relevant legal framework has significant gaps and national technical capacity is limited. (2014)

1. Nubarashen obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste site clean-up service provider company selected and works initiated, including temporary storage is developed on-site. 2. Feasible solutions for Nubarashen site excavated hazardous waste destruction are available. 3. Review of national hazardous waste management legislation and analysis of regulatory framework and corresponding training delivered to nominated site operational staff.

1. Nubarashen obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste site clean-up service provider company selection second stage bids evaluated, temporary storage development is pending results of the above selection. 2. Feasible solutions for Nubarashen site excavated hazardous waste destruction are pending above selection and contracting. 3. Operational staff corresponding training is pending the results of the above selection and contracting.

1. Major obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste site assessment and clean-up design works finalized and national hazardous chemical waste management facility new site selected and approved by the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Republic of Armenia, site development design works finalized and reconstruction works initiated. 2. Nubarashen site clean-up and hazardous waste destruction service provider company selected and contracted. 3. Review of national hazardous waste management legislation and analysis of regulatory framework and identification of hazardous waste management capacity gaps – training materials developed and training delivered to nominated national staff.

1. Major obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste site assessment and clean-up design works completed; national hazardous chemical waste management facility new site selected and approved by the Government of the Republic of Armenia, its’ allocation for the Project purposes is pending upon the results of ongoing audit of chemical plant; a temporary storage construction design as an alternative solution is completed. 2. Nubarashen site clean-up and hazardous waste destruction service provider company selection first stage tender – expression of interest, announced, company prequalification completed; the second stage – request for proposals, announced. 3. Review and analysis of regulatory framework as well as economic implications for banning of plastic packaging is in progress as per request from the Ministry of Nature Protection of the Republic of Armenia.

1. Nubarashen obsolete persistent organic pollutant pesticide waste site clean-up service provider company selected and works initiated, including temporary storage is developed on-site. 2. Feasible solutions for Nubarashen site excavated hazardous waste destruction are available. 3. Review of national hazardous waste management legislation and analysis of regulatory framework and corresponding training delivered to nominated site operational staff.

1. Nubarashen persistent organic pollutant obsolete pesticides waste site clean-up service provider company selection tender ended with no-contract award decision since the best value for money was not achieved and discussions on new solutions were initiated; launching the on-site construction of temporary storage is pending on a decision for further project activities. 2. Selection from feasible solutions under discussion for Nubarashen site excavated hazardous waste destruction are pending upon stabilization of political situation in the country and region, elimination of COVID-19 created limitations, on availability of all necessary resources. 3. Corresponding training for operational staff is pending the results of launch of site clean-up works.

1. Nubarashen persistent organic pollutant obsolete pesticides waste site clean-up service provider company selected and works initiated; the temporary storage site is available. 2. Feasible solutions for Nubarashen site excavated hazardous waste disposal are available. 3. Findings of national hazardous waste management legislation review/analysis is documented, and correspondingly trained site operational staff is available.
